content:
Finally getting around to building a FHIR client and falling at the first hurdle...
Grahame's DSTU2 server (http://fhir2.healthintersections.com.au/open/) does not seem to yield a conformance resource when performing an OPTION verb against the root. In DSTU2 I thought that was the case.
Also, when you do get a CONFORMANCE resource back it claims support for the "CUSTOM" resource which the .NET API is not happy about.
custom should not feature in DSTU2. And I don't know why the Options approach doesn't work. I must have forgotten to make remvoing it for R3 specific to R3
So if CUSTOM is not in DSTU2 - which version is it in? :-)
it's something we talked about for R3. but it hasn't landed.
in my R3 server, it's configurable, and the public servers are not configured, because support is still not complete
